transliteration: Kajje Sanjan|| Poore Panjan|| Jujjhe Khetan|| Digge Chetan||524||
translation: The warriors covered with armours, began to fight in the battlefield and fell down unconscious.524.
The foppish warriors besieged Lanka; the demons army sped away feeling ashamed.525.

transliteration: Digge Sooran|| Bhigge Nooran|| Byaahain Hooran|| Kaamannd Pooran||526||
translation: The brave fighters fell and their faces shone; they wedded the heavenly damsels and fulfilled their wishes.526.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtky rwmvqwr mkrwC kuMB AnkuMB bDih DXwie smwpqm squ ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatke Raamavtaar Makraachh Kounbh Ankounbh Badhah(i) Dhyaae Samaaptam Sat(u)||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled ‘Killing of Makrachh, Kumbh and Ankumbh’ in Ramavtar in BACHITTAR NATAK.
Now begins the description of the war with Ravna :

transliteration: Sonyo Issan|| Jinyo Kissan|| Chappyo Chittan|| Bullyo Bittan||527||
translation: Ravna heard about the victory (of Ram), he being highly infuriated in his mind, began to shout violently.527.

transliteration: Ghiriyo Gadan|| Risan Badan|| Bhajitriyan|| Bhramibhayan||528||
translation: Seeing his citadel besieged his ire grew more and he saw women running away in fear.528.

transliteration: Bharamitabai|| Bhajisabhai|| Triyan Isan|| Gadyo Kisan||529||
translation: All the women are running away in illusion and Ravana obstructed them catching their hair.529.

transliteration: Darain Hahan|| Aho Dayan|| Daro Gade|| Chhamo Bhaee||530||
translation: They were lamenting profusely and praying to God and were asking for forgiveness for their sins.530.

transliteration: Sounisruouttan|| Dhounan Outan|| Outhyo Hathee|| Jiman Bhathee||531||
translation: That persistent Ravana got up on listening to such sounds and it seemed that a fire cauldron was blazing.531.

transliteration: Kachhyo Naran|| Taje Saran|| Hane Kisan|| Roukidisan||532||
translation: He began to kill the human army and with his arrows all the directions were obstructed.532.
